page.title: 12TRADE IN CHITTERNE
page.content: Graham Dean opened his garage servicing business in Chitterne thirty years ago. He services most types of cars taken to him by people in and around Chitterne. His petrol pumps were removed in 1977 as the petrol business was not profitable. Bill Windsor, who was born in the village, has been the local builder for 35 years, employing other professional tradesmen from local villages. A Warminster based milkman delivers milk, bread and dairy produce five times a week. The Carter family took over the running of the Public House in 1983, providing food in addition to bar service.
